concept.title: What is SVG?
concept.shortdesc: SVG is a flexible, scaleable and up-and-coming XML based vector graphics.

ul.li: SVG provides the infinite scalability that raster graphics cannot (jpeg, png).

SVG's files are XML based. Every visual element is represented by textual XML, meaning elements can easily be changed, and changes are never permanent(as with Raster Images). Elements and text can be altered without limit, this wouldn't be possible with a raster image, without having to erase and recreate parts of the image, a long-winded affair, but not with SVG!

Since Text elements within an SVG are actual text in the XML; when the time comes to internationalise and translate the documentation, the task is a walk in the park, the images do not need to be redone in other languages! SVG understands the locale that the image is being presented on, this means that the correct translation will be displayed without the need for multiple files.
Images (for example screen shots) can be embedded within the SVG to allow for screen shot annotations
The content and the style can be separated.
Can be easily transformed as its XML
